title: Introduction to momo
text: data set containing required information can quickly created function sim.momo:
code: # Simulate a data set with tagging data sim <- sim.momo()

title: Introduction to momo
text: main function estimate movement paramters fit.momo:
code: # Fit the movement model fit <- fit.momo(sim)

title: Introduction to momo
text: package includes variety functions allows inspect results:
code: # Plot the results plotmomo.compare(sim = sim, fit = fit)

title: Fine-scale movement modeling based on tagging data
text: package provides two main data sets: one information releases recoveries conventional tags, another track data archival tags. data sets can prepared analysis using built-functions prep.ctags prep.atags. functions allow users specify columns contain release recapture times locations, automatically convert date fields required format. Additional features, speed filter flag implausible movements, also available. full details use function, refer respective help pages (e.g., help("prep.ctags")).  Based spatial extent tagging data, next step define spatial grid. Kalman filter approach require grid model fitting (Mildenberger, Maunder, Nielsen prep), using grid enables spatial prediction, visualization, analysis estimated habitat preferences movement rates. create.grid function offers flexible functionality define custom grids manually include exclude specific grid cells needed. Since manual selection grid cells feasible automated vignette, use grid provided skjepo data set, modify create coarser resolution:  Another important component momo environmental data, characterizes habitat preferences modeled species. prep.env function formats data structure required model:  speed fitting process vignette, use subset available conventional tag data: individual data sets can combined single input object using setup.momo.data function. def.conf function generates list default configuration settings, including flags control model functionalities activated environmental fields aligned model’s time steps. good practice review configuration list ensure default settings align goals structure analysis. Similarly, def.par function generates list default model parameters initial values. users can adjust initial values needed, caution required modifying parameter dimensions. dimensions must consistent input data (e.g., number environmental fields) configuration settings (e.g., whether passive advection, taxis, used). necessary input data prepared, model now ready fitted using momo.
code: #> Removing 5 recaptured tags for which release time is after recapture time (t0 > t1).

title: Fine-scale movement modeling based on tagging data
text: model fitted using fit.momo function. Depending model’s complexity number tags, step may take several minutes. reduce computation time, disable calculation uncertainty estimates setting .sdreport = FALSE. addition input data lists, returned object also includes obj (RTMB) opt (minimizer). contain estimated parameter values details relevant model fitting.

title: Fine-scale movement modeling based on tagging data
text: momo provides several functions visualizing model results. example, since data simulated true parameters known, can use plotmomo.compare function visualize estimated true habitat preferences movement patterns.

title: Fine-scale movement modeling based on tagging data
text: several advanced settings momo covered future vignettes. However, vignette highlights three important ones: () grouping tags release events speed model fitting, (ii) using matrix exponential approach alternative Kalman filter, (iii) mapping parameters fix exclude estimation. common multiple tags released location time. Grouping tags release events can significantly speed movement modeling, analysis performed per event rather per individual tag. potential loss accuracy likely minimal can evaluated sensitivity analyses, grouped approach recommended baseline scenario due efficiency. get.release.event function enables grouping assigning tags release events based specified spatial grid time vector. events can added data list modeling. Note step optional. default, momo uses Kalman filter approach described Mildenberger, Maunder, Nielsen (prep). However, also supports alternative method based matrix exponential. can easily switch two setting use.expm flag configuration list. use matrix exponential approach, simply set use.expm = TRUE. Lastly, may useful map parameters, example, estimate single value directions passive advection. list default mapping settings can generated using def.map function. resulting map can passed fit.momo control parameters estimated, fixed, shared.

title: Fine-scale movement modeling based on tagging data
text: vignette introduced main features workflow momo package estimating animal movement habitat preferences tagging data. Using simulated data set (skjepo), demonstrated prepare required inputs, configure fit model, visualize results. covered preparation conventional archival tag data (prep.ctags, prep.atags), environmental fields (prep.env), spatial grids (create.grid). combined using setup.momo.data format suitable model fitting. Configuration parameter initialization handled def.conf def.par, model fitting performed using fit.momo. plotmomo.compare function allowed us visualize compare estimated versus true movement habitat preference patterns. Several advanced options introduced, including grouping tags release events (get.release.event), switching Kalman filter matrix exponential approaches (use.expm flag), mapping parameters (def.map) simplify constrain estimation. basic example provides foundation applying momo real tagging data. details methodology described Mildenberger, Maunder, Nielsen (prep). details functions arguments can found help files functions (help() ?, dots refer function package). Additional vignettes explore uncertainty estimation, model diagnostics, sensitivity analyses support robust ecological inference management applications.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tobias Mildenberger. Author, maintainer. Anders Nielsen. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mildenberger TK, Maunder M, Nielsen (prep). “momo: R package estimation fine-scale animal movement based tagging data.” Methods Ecology Evolution.
code: @Article{,   title = {momo: an R package for the estimation of fine-scale animal movement based on tagging data},   author = {Tobias K. Mildenberger and Mark Maunder and Anders Nielsen},   journal = {Methods in Ecology and Evolution},   year = {in prep}, }

title: Tagging-based movement modeling
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("tokami/momo") remotes::install_github("tokami/momo", ref = "dev")

title: Tagging-based movement modeling
text: get started momo, load package, simulate tagging dataset, fit movement model:  example illustrates basic workflow: prepare data (simulate), fit model, access results. real applications, momo supports multiple types tagging data, customizable environmental covariates, estimation prediction features. Detailed examples guidance provided package vignettes (see https://tokami.github.io/momo/).

title: Tagging-based movement modeling
text: can find information momo pkgdown page https://tokami.github.io/momo/. page includes links vignettes, functions descriptions, version updates, many . case, question answered pkgdown webpage, please write email maintainer: Tobias Mildenberger. case find bugs, please post issue .

title: Create a grid — create.grid
text: create.grid allows create new grid modify existing grid used fit.momo predict movement rates required matrix exponential approach.

title: Create a grid — create.grid
code: create.grid(   xrange = c(0, 1),   yrange = c(0, 1),   dxdy = c(0.1, 0.1),   select = FALSE,   plot.land = FALSE,   keep.gpar = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   fit = NULL,   grid = NULL )

title: Create a grid — create.grid
text: xrange range x-dimension spatial domain. Default: c(0,1). yrange range y-dimension spatial domain. Default: c(0,1). dxdy resolution grid x y direction. Default: c(0.1,0.1). select logical; TRUE, allows select cells spatial grid. Default: FALSE. plot.land plot.land logical; TRUE, plot land masses using function maps::map. Default: FALSE. keep.gpar logical; TRUE, overwrite graphical parameters. Default: FALSE. verbose TRUE, print information console. Default: TRUE. fit optional; allows extract update grid fitted object class momo.fit returned function fit.momo. Default: NULL. NULL. grid optional; allows update grid class momo.grid returned function create.grid. Default: NULL.

title: Create a grid — create.grid
text: list class momo.grid information spatial domain grid.

title: Create a grid — create.grid

title: Fit the movement model — fit.momo
text: movement model, momo, allows estimation habitat preferences fine-scale movement rates using various types tagging data. supports flexible spatiotemporal modeling options Kalman filter matrix exponential approaches, includes tools data preparation, model fitting, visualization.

title: Fit the movement model — fit.momo
code: fit.momo(   dat,   conf = NULL,   par = NULL,   map = NULL,   run = TRUE,   lower = get.lower.bounds(par),   upper = get.upper.bounds(par),   rel.tol = 1e-10,   do.sdreport = TRUE,   do.report = TRUE,   use.expm = NULL,   use.rel.events = NULL,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Fit the movement model — fit.momo
text: dat data frame input data produced function check.momo.data. conf configuration list produced function def.conf. NULL (default), def.conf used generate default configuration list based input data. par parameter list initial values produced function def.par. NULL (default), def.par used generate default parameter list based input data configuration list. map list parameter mapping produced function def.map. NULL (default), def.map used generate default mapping list based input data configuration parameter lists. run logical; FALSE, AD object returned optimization. Default: FALSE. lower default, get.lower.bounds used. upper default, get.upper.bounds used. rel.tol option passed stats::nlminb sets convergence criteria. Default: 1e-10. .sdreport logical; FALSE, RTMB::sdreport run parameter uncertainties returned. Default: TRUE. .report logical; FALSE, obj$report() run RTMB variables might reported. Default: TRUE. use.expm logical; allows overwrite setting configuration list (conf$use.expm). NULL, setting configuration list used. Default: NULL. use.rel.events logical; allows overwrite setting configuration list (conf$use.rel.events). NULL, setting configuration list used. Default: NULL. verbose TRUE, print information console. Default: TRUE. ... extra arguments RTMB::MakeADFun.

NULL (default), grid dat used. time.cont optional; allows provide extra time vector (e.g. finer resolution) used define release events. title: Get release events — get.release.events

title: Get release events — get.release.events
code: data(skjepo)  dat <- skjepo$dat  tmp <- get.release.events(dat,                           grid = create.grid(dat$xrange, dat$yrange, c(1,1)),                           time.cont = seq(dat$trange[1], dat$trange[2],                                           1/(52*diff(dat$trange)))) dat$rel.events <- tmp$rel.events dat$ctags$rel.event <- tmp$idx

title: Full habitat function — habi.full
text: FIELDS list 3-D array fields used interpolation, first 2 dimensions span x y direction spatial field third dimension indicates time dimension. XR Limits 2-D fields x direction. YR Limits 2-D fields y direction. ienv Indicator matrix mapping model time step time steps field. first dimension corresponds number fields second number model time steps. time.cont Vector continuous model time steps. S List smooth functions relating fields habitat preference functions. dS List derivatives smooth functions relating fields habitat preference functions. ienvS Indicator matrix mapping model time step time step spline. first dimension corresponds number splines second number model time steps.

title: Prepare data-logging tags — prep.atags
text: x List data frames data frame holds information track one data-logging (archival) tag. minimum, data frame include column time x y position tag. names Names columns contain following order: time, location x, location y. origin Optional; allows convert date numeric format date format using origin. Default: NULL. speed.limit Optional; allows apply speed filter km/d. tags imply larger speed assuming distance recapture relase location. Default: NULL. verbose TRUE, print information console. Default: TRUE.

title: Prepare data-logging tags — prep.atags
text: list prepared tags.

title: Prepare data-logging tags — prep.atags
code: data(skjepo)  atags <- prep.atags(skjepo.atags,                     names = c("time","mptlon","mptlat"),                     origin = "1899-12-30")

code: prep.ctags(x, names, origin = NULL, speed.limit = NULL, verbose = TRUE)

title: Prepare mark-recapture tags — prep.ctags
text: x Data frame information mark-recapture (conventional) tags. minimum, data frame include column release recapture date well x y position release recapture. tag recaptured entries recapture columns shoud empty (NA). names Names columns contain following order: release time, recapture time, release location x, recapture location x, release location y, recapture location y. origin Optional; allows convert date numeric format date format using origin. Default: NULL. speed.limit Optional; allows apply speed filter km/d. tags imply larger speed assuming distance recapture relase location. Default: NULL. verbose TRUE, print information console. Default: TRUE.

title: Prepare mark-recapture tags — prep.ctags
text: dataframe prepared tags.

title: Prepare mark-recapture tags — prep.ctags
code: data(skjepo)  ctags <- prep.ctags(skjepo.ctags,                     names = c("date_time","date_caught",                               "rel_lon","recap_lon",                               "rel_lat","recap_lat"),                     origin = "1899-12-30",                     speed.limit = 200) #> Removing 5 recaptured tags for which release time is after recapture time (t0 > t1).

what: Set-up input data for the movement model — setup.momo.data
title: Set-up input data for the movement model — setup.momo.data
text: setup.momo.data combines individual data sets, tags environmental data sets sets required data object required fit movement model (fit.momo).

title: Set-up input data for the movement model — setup.momo.data
code: setup.momo.data(   grid,   env,   ctags = NULL,   atags = NULL,   stags = NULL,   effort = NULL,   knots.tax = NULL,   knots.dif = NULL,   const.dif = TRUE,   trange = NULL,   dt = NULL,   time.cont = NULL,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Set-up input data for the movement model — setup.momo.data
text: grid grid object class momo.grid returned function create.grid. env list environmental covariates class momo.env returned function prep.env. ctags data frame mark-recapture tags class momo.ctags returned function prep.ctags. Default: NULL. atags list archival tags class momo.atags. returned function prep.atags. Default: NULL. stags list mark-resight tags class momo.stags. returned function prep.stags. Default: NULL. effort list effort information class momo.effort. returned function prep.effort. Default: NULL. knots.tax knots taxis component. Default: NULL. knots.dif knots diffusion component. Default: NULL. const.dif logical; TRUE (default), diffusion assumed constant time space. trange vector size two defining limits model time range. NULL (default), time range defined based tags. dt time step model time. NULL (default), time step set 0.1. time.cont optional; allows provide vector representing model time. Default: NULL. verbose TRUE, print information console. Default: TRUE.

title: Set-up input data for the movement model — setup.momo.data
text: list data required fit momo.

title: Set-up input data for the movement model — setup.momo.data
code: data(skjepo)  ctags <- prep.ctags(skjepo.ctags,                     names = c("date_time","date_caught",                               "rel_lon","recap_lon",                               "rel_lat","recap_lat"),                     origin = "1899-12-30",                     speed.limit = 200) #> Removing 5 recaptured tags for which release time is after recapture time (t0 > t1).  atags <- prep.atags(skjepo.atags,                     names = c("time","mptlon","mptlat"),                     origin = "1899-12-30")  grid <- create.grid(grid = skjepo.grid, dxdy = c(10,10))  env <- prep.env(skjepo.env)  dat <- setup.momo.data(grid = grid,                        env = env,                        ctags = ctags,                        atags = atags)

title: Simulate alpha — sim.alpha
text: Simulate alpha parameter specifying taxis component.

title: Simulate alpha — sim.alpha
code: sim.alpha(ll, ul, n = 3, digits = 2)

title: Simulate alpha — sim.alpha
text: ll lower limit runif simulate parameters. ul upper limit runif simulate parameters. n number alpha parameters. Default: 3. digits number significant digits parameters. Default: 2.

title: Simulate alpha — sim.alpha
text: vector simulate alpha values.

title: Simulate archival tags — sim.atags
text: sim.atags allows simulate archival tags.

title: Simulate archival tags — sim.atags
code: sim.atags(   grid,   par = NULL,   env = NULL,   n = 30,   effort = NULL,   trange = NULL,   dt = NULL,   trange.rel = NULL,   xrange.rel = NULL,   yrange.rel = NULL,   trange.rec = NULL,   by = 0.01,   knots.tax = NULL,   knots.dif = NULL,   funcs = NULL,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Simulate archival tags — sim.atags
text: grid grid. par optional; allows specify parameters used simulation. Default: NULL. env optional; allows specify environmental fields used simulation. Default: NULL. n number tags. Default: 30. effort optional; allows specify effort fields used simulation. Default: NULL. trange range model time. Default: NULL. dt optional; resolution model time steps. NULL (default), default time step setup.momo.data used (0.1). trange.rel optional; allows specify specific part time series tags released. Default: NULL. xrange.rel optional; allows specify specific part x range spatial domain tags released. Default: c(0.4,0.6). yrange.rel optional; allows specify specific part y range spatial domain tags released. Default: c(0.4,0.6). trange.rec optional; allows specify specific part time series tags recaptured. Default: NULL. time step tag simulation model. Default: 0.01. knots.tax optional; allows specify knots taxis component. Default: NULL. knots.dif optional; allows specify knots diffusion component. Default: NULL. funcs optional; allows specify movement functions. NULL (default), function get.sim.funcs used. verbose TRUE, print information console. Default: TRUE.

title: Simulate archival tags — sim.atags
text: data frame simulate archival tags.

title: Simulate archival tags — sim.atags
code: data(skjepo)  atags <- sim.atags(skjepo$grid) #> Error in apply(res$knots.tax, 2, duplicated): dim(X) must have a positive length

title: Simulate environmental fields — sim.env
text: sim.env allows simulate environmental fields.

title: Simulate environmental fields — sim.env
code: sim.env(   grid,   nt = 9,   rho_t = 0.85,   sd = 2,   h = 0.2,   nu = 2,   rho_s = NULL,   delta = 0.1,   zrange = c(20, 28),   matern = TRUE,   diagonal = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Simulate environmental fields — sim.env
text: grid grid. nt number environmental fields. Default: 1. rho_t autocorrelation coefficient temporal autocorrelation environmental fields. Default: 0.85. sd standard deviation simulation environmental fields. Default: 2. h parameter matern covariance structure. Default: 0.2. nu parameter matern covariance structure. Default: 2. rho_s parameter matern covariance structure. Default: 0.8. delta parameter matern covariance structure. Default: 0.1. zrange range environmental covariate. Default: c(20, 28). matern logical; TRUE (default), matern covariance structure used simulation environmental fields. diagonal logical; TRUE, diagonal neighbours considered neighbouring structure. Default: FALSE. verbose TRUE, print information console. Default: TRUE.

title: Simulate environmental fields — sim.env
text: list simulated environmental fields.

title: Simulate environmental fields — sim.env

what: Simulate a simple data set — sim.momo
title: Simulate a simple data set — sim.momo
text: sim.momo allows quickly simulate data sets components required fit movement model, fit.momo.

title: Simulate a simple data set — sim.momo
code: sim.momo(   fit = NULL,   xrange = c(0, 1),   yrange = c(0, 1),   dxdy = c(0.1, 0.1),   select = FALSE,   plot.land = FALSE,   keep.gpar = FALSE,   trange = c(0, 1),   dt = 0.1,   nt = 1,   rho_t = 0.85,   sd = 2,   h = 0.2,   nu = 2,   rho_s = 0.8,   delta = 0.1,   zrange = c(20, 28),   matern = TRUE,   diagonal = FALSE,   par = NULL,   n.alpha = 3,   const.dif = TRUE,   knots.tax = NULL,   knots.dif = NULL,   correct.peclet = FALSE,   use.ctags = TRUE,   n.ctags = 500,   use.atags = TRUE,   n.atags = 50,   trange.rel = NULL,   xrange.rel = c(0.4, 0.6),   yrange.rel = c(0.4, 0.6),   verbose = TRUE )

title: Simulate a simple data set — sim.momo
text: fit optional; allows provide list class momo.fit simulate based fitted object. default (NULL), fitted object used. xrange range x-dimension spatial domain. Default: c(0,1). yrange range y-dimension spatial domain. Default: c(0,1). dxdy resolution grid x y direction. Default: c(0.1,0.1). select logical; TRUE, allows select cells spatial grid. Default: FALSE. plot.land logical; TRUE, plot land masses using function maps::map. Default: FALSE. keep.gpar logical; TRUE, overwrite graphical parameters. Default: FALSE. trange range model time. Default: c(0,1). dt resolution model time steps. Default: 0.1. nt number environmental fields. Default: 1. rho_t autocorrelation coefficient temporal autocorrelation environmental fields. Default: 0.85. sd standard deviation simulation environmental fields. Default: 2. h parameter matern covariance structure. Default: 0.2. nu parameter matern covariance structure. Default: 2. rho_s parameter matern covariance structure. Default: 0.8. delta parameter matern covariance structure. Default: 0.1. zrange range environmental covariate. Default: c(20, 28). matern logical; TRUE (default), matern covariance structure used simulation environmental fields. diagonal logical; TRUE, diagonal neighbours considered neighbouring structure. Default: FALSE. par optional; allows specify parameters used simulation. Default: NULL. n.alpha number knots taxis. Default: 3. const.dif logical; TRUE (default), constant diffusion assumed. knots.tax optional; allows specify knots taxis component. Default: NULL. knots.dif optional; allows specify knots diffusion component. Default: NULL. correct.peclet logical; TRUE, diffusion increased peclet number fulfilled. Default: FALSE. use.ctags logical; TRUE (default), mark-recapture tags simulated. n.ctags number mark-recapture tags. Default: 500. use.atags logical; TRUE (default), archival tags simulated. n.atags number archival tags. Default: 50. trange.rel optional; allows specify specific part time series tags released. Default: NULL. xrange.rel optional; allows specify specific part x range spatial domain tags released. Default: c(0.4,0.6). yrange.rel optional; allows specify specific part y range spatial domain tags released. Default: c(0.4,0.6). verbose TRUE, print information console. Default: TRUE.

title: Simulate a simple data set — sim.momo
text: list class momo.sim.

title: Simulate a simple data set — sim.momo
code: sim <- sim.momo() #> Warning: Something went wrong when trying to conver the date information (3rd dimension) to decimal years. Please check the use of the argument 'date.format' to specify the format of the time dimension!

title: momo 0.0.0.9000
text: Estimate habitat preference functions matrix exponential classic Kalman filter Allows using mark-recapture, archival, mark-resight tags Vignette introduction package usage Function documentation
